oai_dc:dc.dc:title: ABOUT THE ENERGY DISSIPATION OVER BARRED BEACH
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Oelerich, Johannes
Dette, Hans-Henning
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: barred beach
energy dissipation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Since wave energy dissipation in the surf zone is a stochastic process closed mathematical formulations cannot be expected. The dissipation was computed using several analytical and/or empirical approaches and compared with prototype measurements in the Big Wave Flume (GWK) in Hannover as well as with field measurements from the west coast, of the Island of Sylt/North Sea. Generally good agreements were found for moderate energy dissipation conditions (spilling-breaker), whereas in the case of plunging breakers, however, the fitting is not solved satisfactory.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 21 (1988): Proceedings of 21st Conference on Coastal Engineering, Torremolinos, Spain, 1988.; 20
